tool_description:
scrape remotely for me through python server;
any website instead of making the execution on your device , 
server code is using requests & beautifulsoup
make sure your scripts are legal and did write it currectly
name: scrape for me
title: scrape for me

api_list.name: post request
api_list.description: only post data to a website
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://scrape-for-me.p.rapidapi.com/post"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "scrape-for-me.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:

url = "https://scrape-for-me.p.rapidapi.com/post"

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "scrape-for-me.p.rapidapi.com"

print(response.json())

api_list.name: bs4 find_all
api_list.description:
as the previous but with `find_all`
if you dont want to use headers remove **/h** from the **rapidurl**

api_list.name: bs4 find
api_list.description:
if you want to make beautifulsoup command to get exact tags or one tag 
if you want to use `find_all` replace find in the end of url
when you use bs4 add to `/get` or `get/h` 
add `/bs4/find ` or `/bs4/find_all`
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://scrape-for-me.p.rapidapi.com/get/h/bs4/find"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "scrape-for-me.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
